substitution.copyText: This was your husband,--look you now what follows;
You cannot call it love, for at your age
substitution.amendedText: You cannot call it love; for, at your age,

substitution.copyText: sense sure you have,| Else could you not have motion but sure that sense| Is apoplext: for madness would not err;|
substitution.amendedText: sense, sure, you have,| Else could you not have motion: but, sure, that sense| Is apoplext: for madness would not err;|
the heyday in the blood is tame

substitution.copyText: Sense, sure, you have,| Else could you not have motion: but, sure, that sense| Is apoplext: for madness would not err;| Nor sense to extasie was ne'er so thrall'd,| But it refery'd some quantity of choice| To serve in such a difference, what Devil was't| ''That thus hath cousn'd you at hodman-blind?| ''Eyes without feeling, feeling without fight,| ''Ears without hands, or eyes, smelling sans all, | ''Or but a sickly part of one true sense| '' Could not so mope,'' Oh shame! where is thy blush?| Rebellious hell, | If thou canst matinyin a Matrons bones, | To flaming youth, let vertue be as wax| And melt in her own fire, proclaim no shame, | When the compulsive ardure gives the charge; | Since frost it self as actively dith burn, | And reason panders will|
''And there I see such black and grieved spots|'' As will leave there their tinct.
Stew'd in corruption, '' honeying and making love| ''Over the nasty stye| O speak to me no more| O speak to me no more| These words like daggers enter in minecars
A slave that's not the twentieth part the tythe
substitution.amendedText: A slave, that's not the twentieth part the tythe

substitution.copyText: Of your precedent Lord a vice of Kings;
substitution.amendedText: Of your precedent Lord. a vice of Kings;--
